SENT.plain: Burkitt lymphoma presenting as a peritoneal and small thickening problem mimicking carcinomatosis is very rare
We present a previously healthy 7-year-old boy with a 1-week history of worsening abdominal distention, vomiting and melena
He demonstrated liver nodules, but no pathologic chest or abdominal adenopathy was present
It was finally determined that he was suffering from Burkitt lymphoma
We present this case because it is such a rare but very significant manifestation of Burkitt lymphoma
